basics.name: Yifan Zhong
basics.label: Seeking 2024 New Grad Roles: Backend/Full-Stack
basics.summary: I'm currently pursuing a Master's degree in Computer Science at UCLA, with a focused interest in backend and full-stack development.

work.name: Shepherd Money
work.summary: Migrated the backend of a personal finance management app from Node.js to Spring Boot, effectively consolidating multiple banking data sources within a unified, streamlined application.

work.name: Microsoft
work.summary: Implemented REST APIs with X++ (Dynamic AX) empowering vendors to convert unsettled receivables into digital assets for immediate transactions on a decentralized financial system to ease the cash flow pressure.

work.name: Dahua Technology
work.summary: Enhanced the new hire onboarding process by developing a tutorial website that supports user registration and login, enables video uploads, and facilitates online forum interactions, streamlining the orientation experience.

projects.name: Cloud Offloading for Real-Time Visual Effect on Smart Glass
projects.summary: Designed and executed a cloud offloading system utilizing Java with Android Studio, which enhanced the smoothness and immersion of user experiences on AR glasses.

projects.name: PintOS
projects.summary: Designed a lightweight operating system for the x86 instruction set architecture in C with support for argument passing, process control and file operation system calls, and floating-point operations.

projects.name: End-to-End Encrypted File Sharing System
projects.summary: Developed Go-based file system APIs, facilitating encrypted file storage and concurrent modifications across multiple devices.

projects.name: RookieDB
projects.summary: Developed a Java-based database system, incorporating a multi-granularity locking mechanism for transaction concurrency and a multi-layered architecture to manage lockable objects and orders of transaction execution.
